WorkItem.ClosedComment: Found the issue, should be fixed for 4.2.1.
WorkItem.Description:
I'm looking to create some optimum gearsets for fire in 4.2, and consistently find the Necromantic Focus (nonheroic item ID 68982, heroic ID 69139) to be valued quite a bit lower than many other trinkets. When I force the trinket to a set mastery value (eg
 450 mastery out of the 480 max stack), its value skyrockets. I have checked, and this is not due to reforging, if you equip the item and force it to not reforge, its value still goes up drastically. I believe there is an issue with how rawr.mage is currently
 modelling the mastery proc on DoT tick.

Comments.Message: Can you attach the character xml you're using so I'll have a reference point to look at?
It might also be simply because when the value is static Rawr reforges it to something more beneficial.

Another thing that came up this week, and I'm going to have this changed in the next release is that there apparently is a tooltip error for this trinket in that it is providing LESS mastery than what is shown in the tooltip. This is one of 2-4 Fireland trinkets where the trinkets are providing different values to what the tooltip is giving.
